results.title: Soylent Green
results.creator_credit: Russell Thacher, Stanley R. Greenberg, Walter Seltzer, Pat Barto, Richard Fleischer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In an overpopulated futuristic Earth, a New York police detective finds himself marked for murder by government agents when he gets too close to a bizarre state secret involving the origins of a revolutionary and needed new foodstuff.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Russell Thacher, Walter Seltzer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: Sown pastures
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment carried out at the CSIRO Research Station, Armidale, N.S.W., which shows the improvement in health and wool returns of sheep grazing sown pastures compared with those grazing natural pasture. Coloured graphs are used to show more clearly the differences between these two groups of sheep.

results.title: Sovereign Hill: goldmining township, Ballarat
results.brief_description: A look at Sovereign Hill- a reconstructed goldmining town in Ballarat. Shows not only the buildings and the implements but also shows how the people lived.

results.title: Sovereign hill
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Sovereign Hill, Ballarat, this Australian documentary recreates the nineteenth century to explain the historical events surrounding gold discovery in Australia. Produced with the assistance of the Management and Friends of Sovereign Hill Gold Mining Township. A study guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Souvenirs, Souvenirs = Memories, Memories
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1962. Rego Boccara is back from a tour of duty in Algeria and attempts to revive his singing career. His agent, Nadia, must help him fight the animosity of Firmani, an influent music-hall owner, who has vowed never to allow Rego back on stage. Meanwhile, Antoine, Rego’s younger brother, is marking time at the local high school, until the day he meets the new music teacher. This ‘coming of age’ drama is a faithful portraiture of France and its youth culture in the early 1960s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1985: Best Promising Young Actor for Pierre-Loup Rajot.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Ariel Zeitoun ; writer, Daniel Saint-Hamont, Ariel Zeitoun ; photography, Bruno de Keyzer ; music, Cyril Assous, Jean-Paul Dreau ; assistant director, Regis Wargnier.
Cast: Christophe Malavoy, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Claude Brasseur, Annie Girardot, Marlene Jobert, Philippe Noiret, Jean Benguigui.
